review.title: Very nice stay...
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time and the experience at this hotel the rooms were clean and the grounds were kept up.

review.title: I can't figure out why this hotel is so expensive.
review.reviewText: I had checked ahead about drinks and a light meal upon arrival and was assured the XYZ Bar (or whatever it was called) would be open late. We had traveled for 21 hours from Nice, France and were in need of winding down. At midnight we arrived with many other travelers (SF Airport location) to find that even though the bar was full of people, it had just closed. Saturday night in SF with travelers pouring into the hotel from all points on the globe, all of us hungry and thirsty, but no amenities and no room service. Are they interested in their customers having a pleasant experience or getting their wait staff home early to bed? In the future I will pick a larger hotel that has facilities open later, or at the very least, has room service.
review.negativeRemarks: Glasses in the rooms instead of plastic cups. An ice machine. Some bathrobes. Info in the room on near-by food options; since the hotel is so limited.
review.locationRemarks: It was near the airport. There was nothing near by but parking lots.

review.reviewText: It is at the end of SFO Airport runway so you hear a lot of planes but I love planes so it doesn't bother me. The air traffic is pretty minimal after 11pm so sleep not affected.
review.locationRemarks: Ten minute walk to Train. Super close to airport

review.title: It was Excellent
review.reviewText: I was extremely pleased with my over all experience, Excellent customer service, Clean Room.
review.positiveRemarks: I extremely satisfied with all staff members, great customer service, and smiles and great attitude at all time.
review.negativeRemarks: Cable Service, I wasn't able to watch the sport game i wanted to but I still enjoy my time at the bar in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: Great Restaurants, and site seeing areas around.

review.title: Undisclosed information
review.reviewText:
The rate was average for the area until arrival when you learn there is a $25 parking fee

But wait that's after you circle aimlessly to find your way through the neighboring parking lot 

This confusion is all so you are forced through a toll gate

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: loud in lobby, parking was terrible and expensive, no breakfast.  I would never recommend

review.title: The room was very modern and appealing.
review.reviewText: The staff was not as helpful as they could have been in check in.  My 1st trip to San Francisco & staff assumed I knew how to get around when I didn't.  There was a big party going on at the hotel and there was no parking.  The first time I had a card that was not the insert type and a quick example on how to use these types of cards would have helped.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were excellent, loved the shower sink and countertop.  I loved the modern look.  I liked the computers easy access.
review.negativeRemarks: Suggest you get a map that shows the hotel, Airport, gas station and car rental return

review.reviewText: The hotel offered a free shuttle to the airport which also meant it shuttled you to the Bart which I found extremely beneficial. The only thing I would have to say it needed was coffee in the lobby for free 24/7 you had the option to purchase a latte or mocha from the fancy machine but there wasn't the coffee option 24/7. Other than that the hotel staff was wonderful and just what I expected! I was nervous when I read others reviews about the noise of the airplanes but honestly I barely heard them at all.

review.title: Terrible customer service
review.reviewText: I will never recommend this horrible hotel to anyone

review.title: The hotel is well run.
review.reviewText: I was able to rest.  You should not impose a minimum length on comments.
review.positiveRemarks: The service, particularly at the bar, was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby was quite noisy in the evening with rock music.
review.locationRemarks:
the hotel is very convenient to the airport. I did not want to
go elsewhere during my stay.

review.title: Wonderful hotel. Like it so much.
review.reviewText: Very nice room. Friendly staff. Love Queen Mary very much.

review.title: Deceptive pricing in a low-end version of luxury
review.reviewText:
When you get to the hotel, the first thing you see is a bar, a literal red-and-white striped physical barrier that prevents you from entering.  Next to it is a sign that says: $X/hour, $YY/day to even enter the lot.

The cost was higher before we even checked in.  That, to me, is RIDICULOUSLY deceptive.  It's located very close to the airport, with tightly controlled areas all about (razor wire) so it was about 4 blocks away when we found a parking spot, we timed it, an 11 minute walk away.  Took less time to drive to the airport than to get to our car from the hotel.

It was a mostly new facility.  Clean.  Nice colors and very refreshing design.  For the advertised price, it was an OK deal, and very conveniently located.  For the actual cost with parking, I would not have chosen it, it would be far above the acceptable price.

The staff was mostly clueless though: they didn't understand or even acknowledge or want to discuss there was a problem arriving to find out the rate was a full **ZZ% higher** than I'd agreed.  They said, "we allow a 15 minute grace period to check in, for free."  I did not see that on any sign when trying to enter, but that wasn't even the point.  You're trapped there and either pay the extra or park 4 blocks away.

I've replaced all reference to the actual costs, percentages and prices with XX YY and ZZ, (per Expedia policy preventing reviews with prices).  This is part of the problem!  Be transparent.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, new building, well designed.  Clearly done by people who understand a good hotel. (Weston chain)
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing data about actual costs: partly a hotel problem and partly an Expedia problem. Unacceptable showing up to find the real cost that much higher.

review.title: Great hidden gem
review.reviewText: The room was super comfortable- love the modern artsy decor
review.negativeRemarks: More amenities- a continental breakfast would have been nice

review.title: Just okay.
review.reviewText: The aloft has cool design and lobby area but the rooms are just okay. Beds were decently comfortable. Only a shower in the bathroom and the drain on it plugged. Overall it was just ok. I might pay an extra $10-30/night for a better hotel next time. If you're looking for a cheaper airport option, this is fine.

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText:
Loved all outside, but inside, if you want to stay all day, there are no movie channels, no restaurant, or food service in the actual hotel. You give all your business to the West in Hotel. Then you go eat over there, and you end up having your cocktails over there. Might as well get a room at the Westin, right?
I loved the place because I had company, but if I went by myself, it would have been blah!

review.title: Great friendly staff. Excellent music.
review.reviewText: We booked a room just for a 3 Hou stay while we waited for late departure of flight to Sydney. Thought we'd just watch TV in the room but th music in the lobby was so we some yhat we stayed and blis ed out to the tunes. Very friendly and helpful staff. I don't like having to pay for parking but I think that's quite normal for hotels in the US...
It was a clean and nice hotel ,I enjoyed staying there

review.title: Nice modern hotel. 5 minutes from the airport.
review.reviewText:
Modern hotel, 5 minutes from the airport. Great for staying a night after or before a flight.
Room was clean. specious and modern. 
Snack bar is very limited and quite expensive, but other than that stay was great

review.title: Such a hip place to be!
review.reviewText: The lobby is awesome! They have a live dj, pool table, a bar and a bunch of board games to play.

review.title: Add $25 for parking
review.reviewText: Hotel staff not particularly attentive. Went to check out front desk person look at me, and then walked away to talk to employee. Was not aware of a $25 parking charge. That might've been my own fault. Close to the airport.
